node.title: Dame Olivia Newton-John is about to be awarded Japan's highest honour
node.description: Dame Olivia Newton-John was the first foreign artist to perform in Fukushima after its 2011 nuclear disaster. Today, Japan has announced it will award her with its highest civilÂ honour, for services to Japanese music culture.
node.content:
["Australian screen and stage legend Dame Olivia Newton-John will be awarded Japan's highest honour,\u00a0for her contribution to developing the Asian nation's musical culture and promoting friendly relations with Australia.", "The Japanese government\u00a0today announced\u00a0it had\u00a0decided to confer the Order of the Rising Sun on the Australian singer, who currently lives in the United States.", "In 2015, Dame Olivia\u00a0became the first foreign artist to perform in Fukushima, after a nuclear disaster four years earlier forced the city's evacuation.", "", "
The Order of the Rising Sun medal is Japan's highest civil honour.(ABC Central West: Luke Wong)
", "\"I first visited Japan in 1972 and since then I've been back more than 10 times, one of my favourite countries and favourite people. A particularly memorable moment was my \"Pray for Fukushima\" concert in 2015 in Fukushima,\" she said.", "\"I was deeply touched by the resilience of the people affected by the disaster and it was a heart-warming experience.", "\"I so look forward to visiting Japan and seeing you all again soon thank you so much.\"", "The 73-year-old has been a campaigner\u00a0for several social and health causes, in particular\u00a0advancing treatments for cancer, including through the Olivia Newton-John\u00a0Cancer Wellness and Research Centre at the Austin Hospital in Melbourne.", "Dame Olivia is a\u00a0British-born Australian star who first battled breast cancer 25 years ago and has since used her own experience, including further cancer diagnoses,\u00a0to promote awareness about the disease.", "However, she has also used her profile to bring attention to post-disaster recovery efforts, including at Fukushima and after Australia's Black Summer bushfires.", "", "
Dame Olivia Newton-John performed alongside John Farnham during the Fire Fight Australia bushfire relief concert after the Black Summer bushfires.(AAP Image: Joel Carrett)
", "At the end of 2019, she\u00a0was made a dame in the\u00a0Queen's 2020 New Years honours list for her services to charity, cancer research and entertainment."]
